arts.ttl: Call for action after 'worst' display from a referee as Coventry City fall foul of Burnley
arts.sum: Worst referee performance the CBS has ever seen. Frank Lampard was not the only one left fuming and frustrated with referee James Bell during Coventry City’s 2-1 home defeat by Burnley.

arts.ttl: 'Different outcome': Coventry City figure comments on Burnley defeat and Frank Lampard's red card
arts.sum: Coventry City assistant Joe Edwards felt his side’s narrow defeat to Burnley could easily have been a “different outcome” after going “toe-to-toe” with the new league leaders.

arts.ttl: Coventry City assistant faces press after Frank Lampard red card for confronting referee
arts.sum: The Sky Blues boss was shown the red card after he marched across the pitch to speak to match official James Bell at the final whistle following a bad tempered and often scrappy, stop-start second half when the home side were frustrated by the Clarets’ gamesmanship as they held on to their narrow lead amid intense pressure. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: 'Proud' Scott Parker on Burnley's win at Coventry City, offside controversy and coming from behind
arts.sum: Scott Parker spoke of his immense pride after his Burnley side battled from behind to beat Coventry City in a big win in the fight for promotion.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Coventry City as 9/10 handed out for player that 'turned game on its head' - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley came from behind to claim a huge victory against Coventry City in the fight for promotion.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Burnley seize advantage as Luton hold Leeds
arts.sum: Burnley triumph 2-1 at Coventry to go top Leeds’s stutter goes on after 1-1 draw at Kenilworth Road Burnley moved to the top of the Championship after Jaidon Anthony’s double secured a 2-1 victory at Coventry, while Leeds missed the chance to return to the summit after a 1-1 draw at Luton. Sheffield United, the overnight leaders, were playing at Oxford in the 3pm kick-offs. Haji Wright controversially opened the scoring early on for Coventry before Anthony struck either side of half-time to extend Burnley’s unbeaten league run to 27 matches. Burnley’s victory also handed Coventry back-to-back league defeats for the first time since Frank Lampard took charge of the Sky Blues in late November. The former England midfielder was also sent off after full-time for confronting the referee, James Bell, after the final whistle. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Sky Blues gift Clarets the points as Lampard sent off at death - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Coventry were the architects of their own downfall again straight from the second half restart when Liam Kitching and Brad Collins conspired to gift the visitors the lead, with the centre-back attempting to nod the ball back to the keeper who had ventured out of his area and was promptly dispossessed by Anthony who snapped up the loose ball and scored into an empty goal for a second time. Haji Wright gave the Sky Blues the early lead when he steered home from close range after an Ephron Mason-Clark shot had taken a deflection off a defender following a terrific shot from Jack Rudoni that the goalkeeper had pushed onto the far post.

arts.ttl: Jaidon Anthony scores twice as Burnley beat Coventry to go top
Coventry City 1-2 Burnley: Clarets bounce back from controversial opener to temporarily move top
arts.sum: Burnley came from behind to seal a hard-earned and crucial victory away at Coventry City to temporarily move top of the Championship.

arts.ttl: 25 images of Burnley fans arriving in Coventry for Championship fixture against Sky Blues
arts.sum: Following the 1-0 victory over Bristol City last weekend, the Clarets faithful are hopeful Scott Parker’s men can add another three points with victory over the Sky Blues as the race for an automatic promotion spot heats up.
